name: Weedmaps: Buy Local Weed
desc: Weedmaps is a go-to mobile app and web platform for cannabis users to discover and shop local dispensaries and products, while also serving as an essential marketing and operational tool for cannabis retailers and brands.

name: Leafly: Find Cannabis and CBD
desc: Leafly is a cannabis information and shopping platform available on mobile and web. It offers a searchable database of cannabis strains, effects, and local dispensaries. Leafly also provides educational content and product ratings to help users make informed decisions.

name: Grow with Jane - Cannabis plan
desc: Grow with Jane is a mobile app and web tool designed for cannabis home growers to track and manage their cultivation process. It offers personalized grow logs, reminders, and progress tracking while also providing strain info and a private journal, supporting users from seed to harvest with structured guidance.

name: MÜV Dispensary
desc: MÜV Dispensary is a Florida-based medical cannabis app available on iOS via the Apple App Store. It enables users to browse and purchase cannabis products (such as flower, edibles, and concentrates), manage orders, access tiered rewards, and connect with customer support—all within a single platform.

name: Affect: Addiction Recovery
desc: Affect: Addiction Recovery is a smartphone-based telehealth app offering a structured outpatient program for alcohol and drug use, including cannabis, opioids, stimulants, and prescription medications. It features counseling via secure video, medication support, behavioral tracking, contingency‑management rewards, and access to peer and group resources. Private, insurance‑covered, and clinically accredited.

name: Curaleaf
desc: The Curaleaf app allows registered users to browse products, view menus, place pickup or delivery orders from Curaleaf dispensaries, and track loyalty rewards. It features deal alerts, location-specific availability, age verification, in-app event notifications, personalized recommendations, and customer support. Available free on iOS and Android; functionality varies by state regulations.p

name: The Apothecarium Dispensary
desc: The Apothecarium app enables ordering cannabis products (flower, edibles, concentrates, tinctures, topicals) from local Apothecarium dispensaries in supported states. It offers express pickup, curbside, drive-thru, or delivery options, real-time order tracking, easy reordering, and a loyalty rewards program. Availability and services vary by location and local regulations, and the app is restricted to The Apothecarium/TerrAscend network.

name: WeedPro: Cannabis Strain Guide
desc: WeedPro: Cannabis Strain Guide provides a database of thousands of strains with details on flavor profiles, potency, genetics, and medical effects. It offers AI-driven recommendations based on user notes and preferences, and lets users rate strains and track experiences.

name: Curaleaf+
desc: Curaleaf+ is an iOS-only app available exclusively in select markets such as Florida and New Jersey. It lets registered users browse product menus, place pickup or delivery orders, and track loyalty rewards while surfacing region-specific promotions and notifications. Unlike the standard Curaleaf app, it focuses on targeted market offerings and iOS users.

name: Eaze
desc: Eaze is a mobile app offering on-demand cannabis delivery in supported regions, enabling users to browse products, verify age, place orders for same-day delivery, track orders in real time, and discover rotating deals. Available on both iOS and Android, it distinguishes itself by focusing on home delivery and real-time tracking features.

name: Quit Weed
desc: Quit Weed is a mobile app guiding users through quitting cannabis with features such as a withdrawal timeline, health improvements tracking, money-saved calculations, achievement rewards, and journaling over the crucial early recovery weeks. It focuses on motivation and progress visualization.

name: Grounded - Quit Weed Tracker
desc: Grounded is a mobile app for iOS and Android dedicated to helping users quit cannabis or take tolerance breaks, offering tools such as a quit journal, withdrawal symptom tracking and tolerance-reset timelines, daily mood logging, progress visualization (e.g., virtual tree growth), savings tracking, achievements, and community support.

name: HiGrade: Cannabis Testing
desc: HiGrade is a smartphone app that uses AI-powered image analysis of trichomes from three photos to estimate THC content and visually grade cannabis flower quality; it also offers cultivation support—such as pest/disease diagnosis, nutrient balance, and optimal harvest timing

name: Kush Scan: AI Weed Identifier
desc: Kush Scan is a mobile app that leverages AI-driven computer vision to identify cannabis strains from photos of dry flower, offering strain names, estimated THC potency, and sativa/indica ratios. It focuses on educational exploration with scan history and optional community features, distinguishing itself from ordering apps.

name: Zen Leaf+
desc: Zen Leaf+ is a mobile app available exclusively on iOS for customers in supported regions, offering order-ahead, pay, and rewards functionality. It lets users browse menus, pay via Aeropay, track orders in real time, and earn loyalty points on purchases, providing a streamlined dispensary experience tailored to participating locations

name: Jane: Find Cannabis Products
desc: Jane: Find Cannabis Products is an iOS-only cannabis shopping app that aggregates dispensary menus, offers real-time inventory updates, and enables users to browse by effects, categories, and price, place pickup or delivery orders where supported, view verified reviews, and receive personalized recommendations and deal alerts on Apple devices

name: Stash Cash Rewards
desc: Stash Cash Rewards is a mobile loyalty app by Columbia Care that enables users to track points, view deals and menus, place orders where supported, and earn rewards redeemable across participating dispensaries. It offers push notifications for launches and restocks, and is available on both iOS and Android in supported regions

name: Everything 420
desc: Everything 420 is a mobile shopping app available on both iOS and Android that aggregates cannabis accessories and related products into a single interface. It offers fast, discreet shipping options, 24/7 customer support, and a wide inventory including glassware, vaporizers, and consumables. Users can browse categories, track orders, and receive deal notifications on their devices.

name: The Flowery
desc: The Flowery is a mobile app that enables Florida medical cannabis patients to browse and order premium indoor-grown strains for delivery or pickup. It features a searchable product catalog, real-time inventory updates, and push notifications for new product drops and exclusive promotions. Only available on iOS.

name: Ivy Hall Dispensary
desc: Ivy Hall Dispensary's mobile app enables Illinois customers—across Chicago, Bolingbrook, Peoria, Waukegan, and other locations—to find nearby dispensaries, place pickup orders, track order status in real time, earn and redeem loyalty points through its Charter Club, contact stores directly, and refer friends for rewards. Operates only within Illinois. Available on iOS only.

name: Study: Adverse Health Effects of Marijuana Use
desc: A 2011 Prescrire International review that examines cannabis’ adverse effects on mental speed and reaction time, anxiety and psychotic risk at high doses, withdrawal symptoms like irritability and sleep disturbance, doubled crash risk when driving, and rare cardiovascular and respiratory complications.

name: Study: Cannabis Use for Exercise Recovery
desc: Survey of 111 cannabis-using adults who regularly exercise to assess recovery benefits: 93% reported CBD aided their post‑workout recovery and 87% reported THC helped, alongside detailed exercise habits and consumption methods.

name: Study: Cannabis in Early Recovery from Opioids and Stimulants
desc: Survey of 14 adults within their first year of opioid or stimulant recovery to identify motives, experiences, and outcomes of increased cannabis use—finding that substitution eased cravings and psychiatric symptoms, supported recovery rituals, but sometimes impaired productivity and social comfort.

name: Study: Cannabis Usage in the U.S.
desc: Survey 138,625 adults across 22 states and two territories in 2022 to map cannabis consumption methods, showing 79% smoked, 42% ate edibles, 30% vaped, 15% dabbed, and half used multiple routes, with vaping and dabbing highest among 18-24 year olds.
